trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents a Windows NT performance counter component.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx x Xxxxxxx XX xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies the size, in bytes, of the global memory shared by performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx$ xx xxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The default size is 524,288 bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx 000$000 xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx $xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the performance counter.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ncategoryName or counterName is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx $xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the performance counter.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue to access the counter in read-only mode (although the counter itself could be read/write); false to access the counter in read/write mode.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxx xxxx $xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx$$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ncategoryName or counterName is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue to access a counter in read-only mode; false to access a counter in read/write mode.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxx x xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxx xxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxx x xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.

\n

The name of the performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.

\n

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

\n

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The machineName parameter is not valid.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ncategoryName or counterName is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the name of the performance counter category for this performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx $xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the description for this performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A description of the item or quantity that this performance counter measures.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the counter, which generally describes the quantity being counted.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This name is displayed in the list of counters of the Performance Counter Manager MMC snap in's Add Counters dialog box.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxx Xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxx XXX xxxx xx$x Xxx Xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the counter type of the associated performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the lifetime of a process.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets an instance name for this performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the computer name for this performance counter

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The server on which the performance counter and its associated category reside.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the raw, or uncalculated, value of this counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxx$ xx xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The raw value of the counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Closes the performance counter and frees all the resources allocated by this performance counter instance.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Increments the associated performance counter by one through an efficient atomic operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The incremented counter value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Increments or decrements the value of the associated performance counter by a specified amount through an efficient atomic operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The value to increment by.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx.

trans-unit.source:
(A negative value decrements the counter.)

\n
trans-unit.target: $X xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.$ $$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The new counter value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Obtains a counter sample, and returns the raw, or uncalculated, value for it.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx$ xx xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An error occurred when accessing a system API.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx XXX.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Me), which does not support performance counters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx $Xx$$ xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Obtains a counter sample and returns the calculated value for it.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The next calculated value that the system obtains for this counter.

\n
